alert.note: Alert for Northern Middlesex; Northern New Haven; Northern New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 13 at 3:29PM EDT until September 13 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following areas, Northern Middlesex, Northern New Haven, Northern New London, Southern Middlesex, Southern New Haven and Southern New London. * WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - This area received heavy rain from earlier today so excessive runoff will more easily occur in this area. Also, this area has a greater likelihood of showers and thunderstorms containing heavy rain going into tonight, so the threat for flash flooding continues. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northern Middlesex; Northern New Haven; Northern New London
